name: Long-Pulley (low Row)
how_to_perform:
1. Stand in front of a low pulley system with the bar at hip height.
2. Hold the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing your knees.

3. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.

4. Let the bar hang down towards the ground, then lift it up to your chest by pulling with your arms.

5. Squeeze your lats and keep your shoulders down as you pull the bar towards your body.

6. Lower the bar back down to the starting position, keeping control throughout the movement.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Long-Pulley (low Row) is a back exercise that targets the lats and other upper back muscles.
